page.title: 11Crosby on Eden:Antiquities
page.content: {Whitrigg Farmhouse}was built in 1702 and there was a Roman fort in the field to the left of the farm drive. Hadrian's Wall runs through the field and the owner, Mr. Hardy is not allowed to plough it because of the remains beneath the ground. In the Middle Ages the land was owned by monks who put up buildings including a dove cote opposite the farmhouse. To the east of Whitrigg Farm, the line of Hadrian's Wall can be followed first as a minor road, then a track and finally a footpath before reaching Oldwall. A hedge marks much of the way, but the only other sign to be seen is the depression to the nortn which is the ditch first dug by the Romans.
